problem:
Let $S$ be a region in the plane with area 4.  When we apply the matrix
\[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 7 & 2 \end{pmatrix}\]to $S,$ we obtain the region $S'.$  Find the area of $S'.$
solution:
Note that
\[\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 7 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = (2)(2) - (-1)(7) = 11,\]so the matrix scales the area of any region by a factor of 11.  In particular, the area of $S'$ is $11 \cdot 4 = \boxed{44}.$
model_solution:
To find the area of $S'$, we first need to find the determinant of the given matrix. The determinant of a 2x2 matrix \[\begin{pmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{pmatrix}\] is calculated as $ad - bc$. 

So, the determinant of the given matrix \[\begin{pmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 7 & 2 \end{pmatrix}\] is calculated as $(2)(2) - (-1)(7)$, which simplifies to $4 + 7 = 11$.
The area of $S'$ is the area of $S$ times the absolute value of the determinant of the matrix.  Since the area of $S$ is 4 and the determinant of the matrix is 11, the area of $S'$ is $4 \times |11| = 44$.
The area of $S'$ is the area of $S$ times the absolute value of the determinant of the matrix. Since the area of $S$ is 4 and the determinant of the matrix is 11, the area of $S'$ is $4 \times |11| = 44$.
The final area of $S'$ is $\boxed{44}$.
